body:
The changes in this pull request fix the `python` package patching issues documented in  #17128. I've verified that the following variants install using `%clang@9.0.0 cflags="-std=gnu11 -fPIC" cxxflags="std=c++11 -fPIC" cppflags= "-fPIC"` in build environment `arch=linux-rhel7-broadwell`:

- `py-kiwisolver ^py-setuptools@41.4.0 ^python@2.7.8`
- `py-kiwisolver ^py-setuptools@41.4.0 ^python@2.7.16`
- `py-kiwisolver ^py-setuptools@41.4.0 ^python@2.7.17`
- `py-kiwisolver ^py-setuptools@41.4.0 ^python@2.7.18`
- `py-kiwisolver ^python@3.6.8`
- `py-kiwisolver ^python@3.7.2`
- `py-kiwisolver ^python@3.7.3`
- `py-kiwisolver ^python@3.7.4`
- `py-kiwisolver ^python@3.7.7`
- `py-kiwisolver ^python@3.8.3`
title: python: fix patch issue for 2.7.X, 3.7.X
